title: Regression Diagnostics: Residual Plots and Leverage
contentHtml:
Residual plots and leverage are crucial in regression diagnostics to identify potential issues with your model.

A residual plot shows the residuals (observed - predicted) against the fitted values. This helps you detect patterns, such as curvature or non-constant variance, that might indicate poor model fit.

title: Regression Diagnostics: Residual Plots, Leverage, and Influential Points
contentHtml:
Regression diagnostics help identify issues in a model's fit to the data.

  • Residual plots reveal patterns or outliers that can indicate poor modeling choices.
  • Leverage measures each observation's influence on the regression line.
  • Cook's distance helps identify influential points that may affect the model's performance.
